page.title: 11LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: The town grew up on banks of the River Calder and has spread up on to the surrounding hillsides as the years have gone by. In the last few years the major roads have been stopped from going through the town with the building of a four lane roadway, which takes traffic to the north and east of the town centre. Shops,banks, public houses, offices and supermarkets are all within easy walking distance of the free car parks and to make shopping even easier, cars can be parked on streets. Many of the shops belong to families who live in the town. At both ends of Commercial Street there are supermarkets, and at the western end of the town centre there is a modern area of traffic free shops known as the Wellington Arcade.
